required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Predicting Location and Extent of Prostate Cancer Using Micro-Ultrasound Imaging
clinical_study.official_title: Predicting Location and Extent of Prostate Cancer Using Micro-Ultrasound Imaging

brief_summary.textblock: The goal of this study is to use a clinical micro-ultrasound to systematically image the prostate before biopsy or surgery. The images from the ultrasound system will be saved and compared to other imaging modalities and pathology in order to develop better tools.

primary_outcome.measure: Diagnostic accuracy of micro-ultrasound biopsy and prostatectomy patients.
primary_outcome.time_frame: From date of micro ultrasound exam until the date of Prostate biopsy data are obtained (average of 7 days
primary_outcome.description: Rate of adequately identified (positive or negative) lesions of prostate cancer will be measured

secondary_outcome.measure: Morphology of lesions detected by mirco-resolution ultrasound
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of micro ultrasound exam until the date of Prostate biopsy data are obtained (average of 7 days
secondary_outcome.description: Hausdoff distance between the ultrasound lesion and pathology lesions would be measured and reported in mm.

secondary_outcome.measure: Volume from systematic and targeted cores
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of micro ultrasound exam until the date of Prostate biopsy data are obtained (average of 7 days
secondary_outcome.description: Volume of cancer from individual biopsy cores will be reported

secondary_outcome.measure: Sensitivity of micro-ultrasound and multiparametric MRI
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of micro ultrasound exam until the date of Prostate biopsy data are obtained (average of 7 days
secondary_outcome.description: Sensitivity of micro-ultrasound and multiparametric MRI in the detection of lesions of prostate cancer will be reported

secondary_outcome.measure: Measuring correlation between Prostatectomy pathology and imaging correlation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of micro ultrasound exam until the date of Prostate biopsy data are obtained (average of 7 days
secondary_outcome.description: Perform a detailed pathologic and imaging correlation between findings on micro-ultrasound, MRI and final surgical histopathology in men who undergo prostatectomy. For prostatectomy specimens, Dice score will be computed, comparing the pixel-wise labels from the annotated pathology specimen to the annotations on multi-parametric magnetic resonance imaging (mpMRI) and micro-ultrasound (this is a unit-less coefficient).Hausdorff Distance, which will give us the greatest distance between the overlapping lesions, with units in millimeters will be reported

secondary_outcome.measure: Specificity of micro-ultrasound and multiparametric MRI
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of micro ultrasound exam until the date of Prostate biopsy data are obtained (average of 7 days
secondary_outcome.description: Specificity of micro-ultrasound and multiparametric MRI in the detection of lesions of prostate cancer will be reported

secondary_outcome.measure: Negative predictive values of high-resolution ultrasound and multiparametric MRI
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of micro ultrasound exam until the date of Prostate biopsy data are obtained (average of 7 days
secondary_outcome.description: Negative predictive values of high-resolution ultrasound and multiparametric MRI in the detection of lesions of prostate cancer will be reported

secondary_outcome.measure: Positive predictive values of high-resolution ultrasound and multiparametric
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of micro ultrasound exam until the date of Prostate biopsy data are obtained (average of 7 days
secondary_outcome.description: Positive predictive values of high-resolution ultrasound and multiparametric MRI in the detection of lesions of prostate cancer will be reported

secondary_outcome.measure: Location from systematic and targeted cores
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of micro ultrasound exam until the date of Prostate biopsy data are obtained (average of 7 days
secondary_outcome.description: Location of cancer from individual biopsy cores will be reported

arm_group.description: EV29L transducer will be inserted in the subject's rectum. Cine sweeps will be performed to save images of: The entire prostate from posterior to anterior (may require 2 sweeps to cover base and apex) The peripheral zone using the highest zoom setting (30mm depth) on the system (may require 2 sweeps to cover base and apex). Analysis of these images will be performed after surgery but before prostatectomy

intervention.description: clinical micro-ultrasound, imaging Device, Manufacturer; Exact Imaging

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Scheduled for MR-US fusion prostate biopsy or radical prostatectomy
- Agree to consent to the study
Exclusion Criteria:
- Does not agree to consent.
